description: A curfew is in place throughout the country with persons under 18 and those over 65 years of age on a 24-hour curfew. They cannot leave their house for any reason. For all other age groups, there is a curfew of 8 pm until 5 am, where you must stay home.
Bosnia and Herzegovina, March 16 - declaration of the state of emergency in the whole Federation.
Republika Srpska declares state of emergency on March 28. This decision became effective on March 29.

Bosnia and Herzegovina, July 17 - federal government declared a state of sanitary epidemic situation regarding COVID 19. The proclamation of the COVID-19 epidemic on the entire territory of the Federative Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBIH) does not directly concern the population, but implies more operative action of all relevant institutions that act in this situation, and implements measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 on the territory of FBiH.

If necessary and depending on the situation, the order envisages the possibility of sanitary control at border crossings located on the territory of the Federation of BiH and implementation of measures related to that control, quarantine, provision of necessary vaccine reserves when vaccines are available, immunization of population when vaccines are available. , as well as the implementation of other measures ordered by the Federal Minister of Health or the Government of the Federation of BiH.
On March 15, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina obligates those crossing the border to complete a sanitary questionnaire.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Bosnia and Herzegovina bans travel from People’s Republic of China Wuhan Province, from South Korea, Japan, Italy, Iran, France. Romania, FR Germany, Austria, Spain, Switzerland and Belgium on the 15th of March.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 23, the government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina adopted an amendment which halts border crossings of citizens of the Republic of Croatia working in the Brcko District and vice versa, with merely a certificate of employment. From March 23 onwards, isolation will be issued.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The government of Bosnia and Herzegovina bannes all foreign nationals from entering Bosnia and Herzegovina on March 24. The exception is made to EUFOR, NATO, medical personnel or persons associated with humanitarian aid.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Sarajevo airport will close to commercial passenger travel at 0600 on Monday, March 30, 2020 and the last scheduled commercial flight departed BiH on March 27, 2020.

Bosnia extended the COVID-19 related suspension on passenger flights, as well as the ban on nonresidents entering the country, until at least June 1. Cargo, humanitarian, medical, and repatriation flights are exempt from the flight ban.
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Bosnia and Herzegovina is enforcing mandatory negative PCR testing for anyone entering the country, regardless of their age. This is in response to the selective travel allowances announced on July 16, effective immediately.
On March 21, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosia and Herzegovina purchased 200,000 masks, 200,000 pairs of gloves, 20,000 protective gowns from the Nardon Republic of China.

description:
Bosnia and Herzegovina Federal Government published on May 12 an order to the Federal Headquarter of civil protection regarding the distribution of the health resources and equipment that was given as donation by the government of Turkey. In the list are protective suits, three-layer medical masks, universal masks, protective masks, protective gloves, alcohol. 

The order is defining which canton gets exactly defined amount of the above mentioned donation.

Bosnia and Herzegovina Federal Government published on May 12 an order to the Federal Headquarter of civil protection regarding the distribution of the health resources and equipment that was given as donation by the government of Turkey. In the list are protective suits, three-layer medical masks, universal masks, protective masks, protective gloves, alcohol. 

The order is defining which canton gets exactly defined amount of the above mentioned donation.

The order is defining which canton gets exactly defined amount of the above mentioned donation.

Bosnia and Herzegovina Federal Government published on May 12 an order to the Federal Headquarter of civil protection regarding the distribution of the health resources and equipment that was given as donation by the government of Austria. In the list are blankets, disposable beddings, hygiene packets, protective gloves. 
The order is defining which canton gets exactly defined amount of the above mentioned donation.

In the list are blankets, disposable beddings, hygiene packets, protective gloves. 
The order is defining which canton gets exactly defined amount of the above mentioned donation.

Bosnia and Herzegovina Federal Government published on May 27 an order to the Federal Headquarter of civil protection regarding the distribution of the health resources and equipment that was given as donation by the government of Azerbaijan. In the list are blankets, pillows, liquid soap, disinfectant, ethyl alcohol, hand sanitiser, cleaning products. The order is defining which canton gets exactly defined amount of the above mentioned donation.

description: Republika Srpska is enforcing a lockdown of all seniors over the age of 65 as of March 21. As of May 6, this policy was eased slightly, to allow seniors movement three times a week, within a curfew of 5:00 - 20:00.

Starting march 16, buildings of the Government of the Brcko District of BiH will be disinfected three times a day during which the work with the parties inside the building will be interrupted. The following periods are: 7am to 8am, from 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. and from 12.30 to 1.30 pm.
type_text: Infection of premises of government building(s) during the following periods: 7 a.m. to 8 a.m., from 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. and from 12.30 to 1.30 p.m.. During these times work will be interrupted

description: On March 18. the Government of the Brcko District in Bosnia and Herzegovina restores prices of food products, hygiene products and other products to the prices in force on march 5, 2020.
type_text: The Government of the Brcko District in Bosnia and Herzegovina restores prices of food products, hygiene products and other products to the prices in force on march 5, 2020.

description: On March 19, the government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina urged citizens to report all irregularities and violations of issued measures regarding the corona crises through the use of Citizens Patrol app through which citizens could already report communal, traffic and other problems through the use of photos and videos
type_text: The request to civilians to report non-compliance with issued corona virus measures

description: On March 21, the Crisis Staff of the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina banned the public disclosure and transmission of false information regarding the corona virus.

description: On March 23, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina ordered volunteer organizations, citizen groups and individuals to assist the population.
On March 24, Brcko District Crisis Staff Commander and Brcko District Mayor ordered the Brcko District Inspectorate to make the names of those person who have violated isolation decisions public.
Starting March 16th, Bosnia requires two weeks of self-isolation for all its nationals arriving in the country from abroad

On March 20, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina implemented a 14-day quarantine with the possibility of a additional 14 days for persons entering the Brcko area from other countries

On March 20, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina implemented a 14-day quarantine with the possibility of a additional 14 days for persons entering the Brcko area from other countries

On March 15, the Government of the Brcko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina required businesses such as "restaurants, cafes,  discos, pharmacy shops, hotels etc." to comply with the following recommendations:
- Ensure good ventilation of the premises

- Regular cleaning and disinfection of toilets

- Provide access to places where hands can be washed with soapy water

- Provide visibly visible hand sanitizers (replenish regularly)

- To arrange seating arrangements in catering establishments so as to provide a distance of at least one meter between guests.

- At stores observe a distance of at least one meter when waiting in line at the cash register.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina - by order from March 24 whose provisions were later extended by the orders from April 17 and April 29, work of private dental practices and dental laboratories is forbidden and public health centres are ordered to organise emergency dentist service. 

The application of these orders ceased on May 15, by another federal order.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - from. July 7 public gatherings in Federation are limited to 100 people in the closed and 300 people in the open area.  

All gatherings within these limits must take place in a space that allows a mandatory physical distance of at least 2 meters between persons (except for the people from the same household).

In order to reduce the risk of COVID-19, as well as the protection of personal health, during the gathering, it is necessary to adhere to the recommendations made by the Institute of Public Health in the Federation of BiH (hygienic and epidemiological measures). 

The organizers of the gatherings are responsible for the implementation of measures at the rallies. The organizer is obliged to register the holding of the meeting in accordance with the regulations on public gatherings, as well as the crisis headquarters of the cantonal / county ministries of health.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force
